四大節: (しだいせつ) - the four grand national holidays (Prayer to the Four Quarters, Empire Day, the Emperor's Birthday, Emperor Meiji's birthday; 1927-1948)
四天王: (してんのう) - the Four Heavenly Kings (Dhrtarastra, Virudhaka, Virupaksa, and Vaisravana); the big four (i.e. four leaders in a given field)
四夷: (しい) - the surrounding barbarians (from a Chinese perspective)
四姓: (しせい) - the four great families of the age (esp. the Minamoto clan, the Taira clan, the Fujiwara clan and the Tachibana clan); varna (each of the four Hindu castes)
四字成句: (よじせいく) - Chinese four-character phrase or idiomatic expression
四字熟語: (よじじゅくご) - four-character idiomatic compounds
四季の移ろい: (しきのうつろい) - passage of the seasons; change of the four seasons
四季咲き: (しきざき) - blooming in each season
四季折々: (しきおりおり) - (yoji) from season to season; season by season; of each season; in each season
四季折折: (しきおりおり) - (yoji) from season to season; season by season; of each season; in each season
四季施: (しきせ) - livery; servant's clothes provided by employers
四川料理: (しせんりょうり) - Szechuan cuisine; Sichuan cuisine

四強: (よんきょう) - final four (in a tournament)
四強雄蕊: (しきょうゆうずい) - tetradynamous stamen
四当五落: (よんとうごらく) - sleep four hours and pass, sleep five hours and fail (when cramming for university entrance exams)
四房: (しぶさ) - {sumo} four tassels hung above the ring
四手: (しで) - zigzag-shaped paper streamer often used to adorn Shinto-related objects; (四手, 垂 only) hornbeam (deciduous tree in the birch family)
四指陸亀: (ヨツユビリクガメ) - Russian tortoise (Agrionemys horsfieldii); Horsfield's tortoise; Central Asian tortoise; steppe tortoise; four-toed tortoise
四捨五入: (ししゃごにゅう) - (yoji) rounding half up (i.e. fractions)
四捨五入機能: (ししゃごにゅうきのう) - round-off function; rounding
四方: (よほう) - the four cardinal directions/north, east, south and west/all directions; (しほう, よほう only) surroundings; (しほう only) many countries/the whole world; (よも only) all around/here and there; (しほう, よほう only) square/quadrilateral/four-sided figure; four sides (of a square)
四方八方: (しほうはっぽう) - (yoji) in all directions
四方反かんな: (しほうそりかんな) - wooden plane with a convex base curved both along the direction of cutting and across the blade
四方反りかんな: (しほうそりかんな) - wooden plane with a convex base curved both along the direction of cutting and across the blade
四方反り鉋: (しほうそりかんな) - wooden plane with a convex base curved both along the direction of cutting and across the blade
四方反鉋: (しほうそりかんな) - wooden plane with a convex base curved both along the direction of cutting and across the blade
四方山話: (よもやまばなし) - talk about various topics
四方拝: (しほうはい) - Prayer to the Four Quarters (Japanese imperial New Year's ceremony)
四方竹: (しほうちく) - Tetragonocalamus quadrangularis (type of bamboo); Chimonobambusa quadrangularis
四日: (よっか) - fourth day of month; four days
四日市ぜんそく: (よっかいちぜんそく) - Yokkaichi asthma
四日市喘息: (よっかいちぜんそく) - Yokkaichi asthma
四暗刻: (スーアンコー) - {mahj}  four concealed triplets (yakuman) (chi:); four concealed three-of-a-kinds
四更: (しこう) - fourth watch of the night (approx. 1 am to 3 am)
四書五経: (ししょごきょう) - (yoji) the Four Books and Five Classics of Confucianism; the Nine Chinese Classics
四曼: (しまん) - four types of mandala (in Shingon)
四月テーゼ: (しがつテーゼ) - April Theses; series of directives issued by Lenin after his return from exile
四月病: (しがつびょう) - euphoria experienced by college students or workplace recruits at the beginning of school or work
四月馬鹿: (しがつばか) - April fool; April fool's day
四有: (しう) - the four stages of existence: birth, life, death, and limbo
四本柱: (しほんばしら) - {sumo} four posts that used to support the roof over the ring
四本足: (よんほんあし) - four-legged; four legs
四柱推命: (しちゅうすいめい) - (yoji) Four Pillar astrology; originally Chinese method of fortune-telling based on the time, date, month and year of a person's birth
四條笛鯛: (ヨスジフエダイ) - bluestripe snapper (Lutjanus kasmira); bluestripe seaperch

四次元超立方体: (よじげんちょうりっぽうたい) - tesseract

四段活用: (よだんかつよう) - yodan verb conjugation (verb form of classical Japanese)
四民: (しみん) - the four social classes (samurai, farmers, artisans, merchants); the masses
四気: (しき) - weather of the four seasons (warmth of spring, heat of summer, cool of autumn, and cold of winter)
四法印: (しほういん) - the four signs of orthodox Buddhism
四海: (しかい) - the whole world; the seven seas
四海兄弟: (しかいけいてい) - (yoji) people in the whole world being all brothers; universal brotherhood
四海波静か: (しかいなみしずか) - The world is at peace
四獣: (しじゅう) - four beasts (tiger, leopard, black bear, and brown bear); four gods said to rule over the four directions
四王天: (しおうてん) - heaven of the Four Great Kings; one of the six heavens of the desire realm
四球: (しきゅう) - {baseb} four balls; base on balls; a walk
四瑞: (しずい) - the four auspicious beasts from Chinese mythology
四畳半: (yojouhan) - quatro tatames e meio, quarto de quatro tatames e meio; quarto pequeno, especialmente para encontros
四畿内: (しきない) - the Four Home Provinces (Yamato, Yamashiro, Settsu, and Kawachi); obsolete in 757 when Izumi was established as a separate province from Kawachi
四百余州: (しひゃくよしゅう) - all China
四百四病: (しひゃくしびょう) - (yoji)  every type of disease
四百四病の外: (しひゃくしびょうのほか) - love-sickness
四矢: (よつや) - matched set of four arrows for target shooting
四神: (しじん) - four gods said to rule over the four directions; (in China) four gods said to rule over the four seasons
四神獣: (しじんじゅう) - four divine beasts; guardian deities of the four cardinal points
四神相応: (しじんそうおう) - (yoji) an ideal topography for the four Taoist gods, with a river in the east, a broad avenue in the west, a basin in the south, and a hill in the north
四種姓: (ししゅせい) - varna (each of India's four castes)
四種曼荼羅: (ししゅまんだら) - four types of mandala (in Shingon)
四端: (したん) - the Four Beginnings (Mencius); the Four Sprouts
四等官: (しとうかん) - four administrative positions (of the ritsuryo system: kami, suke, jou, sakan)
四緑: (しろく) - fourth of nine traditional astrological signs (corresponding to Jupiter and south-east)
四聖: (しせい) - the four great sages (Buddha, Christ, Confucius, Socrates)
四股: (しこ) - {sumo} wrestler's ceremonial leg raising and stomping
四肢動物上綱: (ししどうぶつじょうこう) - Tetrapoda
